Name: Frances Arnold
Discovery: pioneered the use of directed evolution to design new enzymes, with applications from pharmaceuticals to renewable fuels.

Name: Linda Buck
Discovery: what makes us human: our perceptions, preferences and memories

Name: Maria Goeppert Mayer
Discovery: nuclear physics, the revelatory nuclear shell model

Name: Carol Greider
Discovery: molecular biology, telomerase, an enzyme that is key to the ageing process

Name: Dorothy Hodgkin
Discovery: X-ray crystallography to “see” penicillin, vitamin B12 and insulin

Name: May-Britt Moser
Discovery: how the brain perceives where the body is positioned, cellular basis of cognitive function

Name: Christiane Nüsslein-Volhard
Discovery: how the genes in a fertilised egg form an embryo

Name: Rosalyn Yalow
Discovery: radioimmunoassay, a method for measuring concentrations of substances in the blood

Name: Ada Yonath
Discovery: see and understand the complex and crucial ribosome molecule, leading to new antibiotics and a better understanding of antibiotic resistance

Name: Tu Youyou
Discovery: cure for malaria, ultimately extracting a compound – artemisinin – that has saved millions of lives
